name: Potassium sulfide
desc: Potassium sulfide is the inorganic compound with the formula K2S. The colourless solid is rarely encountered, because it reacts readily with water, a reaction that affords potassium hydrosulfide (KSH) and potassium hydroxide (KOH). Most commonly, the term potassium sulfide refers loosely to this mixture, not the anhydrous solid.
Other names:
Dipotassium monosulfide,
Dipotassium sulfide,
Potassium monosulfide,
Potassium sulfide
Solubility in other solvents:
soluble in ethanol, glycerol
insoluble in ether
Related compounds: Potassium hydrosulfide, Potassium sulfite, Potassium sulfate
